result.execSummary:
All charges against Mariah S Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mariah S Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah S Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah S Smith in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to a Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. 
Court reviewed the complaint and did not probable cause.
Upon motion of State, Court ordered case DISMISSED.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/6/22 @ 2:30p
